Author: phm87#7395
Content:
I'd like to change something in Komodo but I don't know how to do it properly. Can you help me ?
Few months ago, a virus was injected in few yiimp pools. The BTC wallet was emptied by hacker.
Entry points were identified and fixed into yiimp but we wanted to add a kind of "condom" within bitcoin wallet code.
With existing options, some pools disabled broadcasting of tx and broadcast manually.
I performed few changes into bitcoin code (forbid to withdraw more than 1% of total balance with sendmany and sendtoaddress, forbid dumpprivkey and so on). Changes were tested successfully but with hardcoded values into sendmany and sendmoney
I tried to make it more clean (either use arguments at compilation OR use the coin.conf file) but my code doesn't work. I asked help to some bitcoin devs that I'm in contact with but they didn't help so much. They suggest to use a proxy in front of the coin node but it will reduce perfs and I'm not fan to use additional software
As my pool doesn't have bitcoin and only altcoins, I'm interested to have such a feature into komodo and other altcoins
I discussed it briefly with @metaphilibert he suggested to me to talk about it in public
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/compare/master...phm87:patch-1
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/compare/master...phm87:patch-2

Author: phm87#7395
Content: I discussed this kind of changes with exchange guys and it seems that this kind of tiny change is well-known and used by big hot wallets. I'd like that this option becomes opensource whatever it is about changing 6 lines of codes (with hardcoded values, it is very short and obvious for many developers)

Author: phm87#7395
Content: Of course, give me few minutes to gather links. I'll show you some yiimp fixes but I won't show you the "how to reproduce the hack"

Author: phm87#7395
Content: 3 "how to repro the hack" are publics though

Author: metaphilibert#0926
Content: just to be clear i never suggested to talk about a potential issue in public hem üòÖ

Author: Mylo#8306
jl777c#5810
Content: to make a custom version without some rpc calls, just comment out the lines in rpcserver.cpp

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that way the custom daemon wont have the rpc call available

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as far as limiting sendtoaddress, maybe enforcing a whitelist is a better way? that way only destinations that are already approved gets sent out

Author: Alexfrog#1338
Content: So with DPoW, does one need to maintain a synced bitcoin blockchain in order to verify the Komodo blockchain?

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: No

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: Client only need KMD

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: Notary nodes need both KMD and BTC full nodes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the notaries do

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: if you understand how lite wallets/spv work, you can see how komodo nodes will be able verify the pow that is backing up the notarised transactions without running btc nodes

Author: Alexfrog#1338
Content: hypothetically, if you didnt trust the notaries, would you need to have a synced btc blockchain?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, anybody can independently validate

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: or you could use SPV servers

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
>  if you didnt trust the notaries
the other KMD nodes already don't trust the notaries, they verify(validate) every notarization done by notaries, if a notarization is found to validate consensus rules, it is rejected by the regular KMD nodes
